result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery M Rod

defendant.name: Rod, Zachery M
defendant.address: 722 N. Beaumont Road, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:34 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zachery M Rod in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Zachery M Rod.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard, waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:01 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Zachery M Rod not in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Zachery M Rod.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court indicates a call was received from def.'s girlfriend indicating def. was in the hospital and requested a continuance
Atty Steiner ok with rescheduling the arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:40 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Zachery M Rod in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Zachery M Rod.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Counsel are both prepared to proceed to preliminary hearing today

1W - CASEY COX - Sworn by Court
exam. by Atty. Steiner
cross  exam. by Atty. Zaleski

State moves for bind over. 
Atty. Zaleski objects to bind over

Court finds probable cause and binds def over for further proceedings. 
Court will schedule arraignment for another date
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:34 PM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Zachery M Rod in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Zachery M Rod. 

Court confirms defendants DOB.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Steven Zaleski
Letter from Denise and Larry Rod
Per Pub. Def., he DOES NOT QUALIFY for Pub. Def. representation.  He is to stop by the courthouse and pick up court apptd. paperwork.  Pub. Def. also says his birth date is wrong in CCAP,  nad

1:47 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zachery M Rod in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zachary M Rod appeared by video, in custody in the Crawford County jail.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

Court confirms on the record the correct spelling of the defendants name. Defendant is heard. The correct spelling is Zachery Rod and confirms the DOB of 05/30/2001.

State is heard on bond. State recommends a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant has no comment. 

Court orders a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
